title: When I start a game this error pops up.
body:
After I finish champ select and then get into game, instead of opening the league of legends game it comes up with an error which says "The procedure entry point D3DXGetShaderConstantTableEx could not be located in the dynamic link library C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\solutions\lol_game_client_sln\0.0.1.155\deploy\League of legends.exe." 
I've reinstalled the game multiple times and tried repairing it too.
If you have any solutions, please send them my way.
Thank you!

replies.body: I have the same problem, happened to me right after I reformatted my pc, very sad there's actually no fix. Riot should do something.

Ah, it's been a while since I've seen this error. This usually happens if there are missing components for Directx that League relies on. You should be able to resolve this by running all available windows updates and installing [**this**](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=34429) standalone Directx9 package.

Let me know if this fixed it for ya.

It doesn't let me run the program, when I try to run it it says "You must be running Windows 98, Windows Millennium Edition, Windows 2000, Windows XP or Windows Server 2003 family to in stall the DirectX 9.0."

Any alternatives?

It sounds like there may be some serious issues with your Windows installation. I'd recommend contacting your PC's manufacturer if it's still under warranty, otherwise, you may want to visit a local computer repair shop for further assistance.

If you have any further questions, let me know.
